thread.title: Cameron Village Celebrates Founder's Day with Night at the Movies
thread.title_full: Cameron Village Celebrates Founder's Day with Night at the Movies - PR.com

author: PR.com
title: Cameron Village Celebrates Founder's Day with Night at the Movies
text:
Cameron Village Celebrates Founder's Day with Night at the Movies
A free outdoor Night at the Movies will highlight the end of summer at Cameron Village Founder's Day on September 18. Classic car show, free popcorn and picnic dinner take-out options are all part of the celebration. Family friendly.
Raleigh, NC, September 02, 2015 --( PR.com )-- Cameron Village Founder’s Day celebration on Friday evening, September 18, 2015 includes a free outdoor movie presentation will begin at 8 pm, preceded by a classic car show from 5 – 7 pm. Free popcorn, courtesy of the Cameron Village Merchants Association. Night at the Movies will be held on Woodburn Rd., just a few feet from the original Village Theater. The large canvas located above Johnson-Lambe sporting goods store is the movie screen for the evening. All the King’s Men, winner of the 1949 Oscar for best picture is the evening’s feature presentation (Run Time: 109 Minutes). Lawn chairs and picnic accessories are welcomed and coolers are allowed; however, no alcohol is allowed to be carried in, no glass containers are allowed and personal coolers are subject to inspection. Picnic carry-out selections are available from Village restaurants; let someone else do the cooking and enjoy dinner and a movie in Cameron Village. Call restaurants directly to place orders; prices are for take-out only and customers must be sure to mention that the order is for Cameron Village movie night. Selections available:
Café Carolina:
919.821.7117
401 Daniels Street
$10 box with a sandwich/salad with chips, a cookie, and a beverage for that evening. Sandwich and salad selections can be found on Café Carolina’s catering menu.
Cameron Bar & Grill:
919.755.2231
2018 Clark Avenue
$8 per sandwich/side
Grilled Pimento Cheese Sandwich
Pulled Pork BBQ Sandwich W/ Slaw
Sides – Tomato Cucumber Salad or Potato Salad
Moe’s:
919.664.6637
506 Daniels Street
$5 dollars per person
JR burrito, chips & salsa
Tea available by the gallon – serves 10 people.
Sugarland:
919.835.2100
2031 Cameron Street
Buy one; get one free gelato.
Piccola Italia:
919.833.6888
423 Woodburn Road
Picnic for 2 ($18 +tax)
Small one topping pizza; mozzarella sticks; two beverages (soda, tea or bottled water)
Picnic for 4 ($24 +tax)
Large one topping pizza; mozzarella sticks; four beverages (soda, tea or bottled water)
Village Deli:
919.828.1428
500 Daniels Street
Box Dinners include sandwich, side item and a chocolate chip cookie.
Sandwich options:
Turkey
Chicken Salad
Tuna Salad
Roast Beef
Carolina Burger
Philly Steak
Reuben
Island Chicken
Side options:
Fries
Chips
Pasta Salad
Potato Salad
Village Draft House:
919.833.1373
428 Daniels Street
$8.99 Movie Night Menu take-out only
Sandwiches: Chilled smoked Turkey or Roast Beef on toasted Sourdough with Lettuce, Tomato and Swiss cheese or BLT (Bourbon Cured Bacon, Lettuce and Tomato) on toasted Sourdough. Served with choice of Macaroni Salad or fresh Potato Chips.
$2.99 Kid's Meal: Grilled American Cheese on Sourdough Bread or State Fair Corndog or hand breaded Chicken Bites. Served with Grapes and Carrots with a side of Ranch; includes kid's drink and Rice Krispy treat
$6.49 Small Chicken Bites: 1/2 order of hand breaded Chicken Bites; choice of Wing Sauce and Ranch or Bleu cheese for dipping. Served with a side of fresh Potato Chips
$10.49 Large Chicken Bites: Whole order of hand breaded Chicken Bites with choice of Wing Sauce and Ranch or Bleu cheese for dipping. Served with a whole order of fresh Potato Chips.
